summary: The Help Federal Employees During Shutdowns Act amends the Social Security Act to provide unemployment compensation to federal employees during government shutdowns, specifically those performing emergency work. It mandates states offer this compensation during fiscal years 2026 and 2027. The bill also details provisions for repayment by employees who later receive back pay and outlines how the federal government will reimburse states for the unemployment benefits and associated administrative costs, using funds from the Unemployment Trust Fund.
